children.text: It appears that the builder has installed 'thermal' insulation in the areas where 'acoustic' (sound) insulation should be installed.

Although it is difficult to be 100% certain about which insulation has been installed in these areas, we suspect that the incorrect insulation type has been used, as the acoustic batts are often different in colour and/or texture.

Instead of asserting that this is the case, we instead ask that the builder investigate further to provide evidence to the owner that these insulation batts have the same acoustic efficiency rating as the contractual documentation requires. Should the insulation be the incorrect type, it should be replaced prior to plasterboard installation, and the owner given an opportunity to inspect them.
